---
title: 'uv-build'
description: "Build an expression using uv for dependency management"
---

Build an expression in an isolated, reproducible environment using uv. Same behavior as `xorq build` but runs via the packaged sdist so dependencies match the build environment.

## Usage

Point at a script and the expression variable name to build with uv.

```bash
xorq uv-build <script_path> [OPTIONS]
```

## Arguments

Positional and required arguments.

| Argument | Description |
|----------|-------------|
| `script_path` | Path to the Python script that defines the expression |

## Options

Optional flags for output location and cache.

| Option | Short | Default | Description |
|--------|-------|---------|-------------|
| `--expr-name` | `-e` | `expr` | Name of the expression variable in the script |
| `--builds-dir` | | `builds` | Directory where artifacts are written |
| `--cache-dir` | | (system cache) | Directory for parquet cache files |

## Example

Build the expression named `expr` from a script using uv.

```bash
xorq uv-build my_script.py -e expr --builds-dir builds
```
